message:
السلام عليكم

ممكن من فضلكم اعرف ايه الفرق بين IQueryable و IEnumerable ؟ حالوت افهمه الفارق بس مش واضحة برده ؟

يعنى امته استخدم دى وامته استخدم دى ؟ وايه الافضل بينهم وليه ؟

data.message:
IQuerable is a Linq Expression that is ready to execute against DB 
I Enumerable is a collection of object where you can loop throw it one by one
You can chain queries to your iquerable and then executing them at once at the end to limit the results returned, but not valid for ienumerable

in simple plain direct:
IQueryable, is used when you want to build a queryor conditional query. For example, your function may take a filter or may not, hence you need to build your query first then execute it.
IEnumerable, is used when you "خلاص" will execute the query, or in other words, you want to bring your query data into memory.

bos ya m3allem akbar far2 bain-hom howa en IQueryable  lw 3malt 3lai ai linq expression (any linq) it will go to the database server and execute a query matches the linq expression
but IEnumerable da mesh by7sal 3laih da lama bt-execute ai linq byet3mael m3a enumerator bta3oh 3la 6ool :D
